page.title: 03ENVIROMENT
page.content: The area consists of an{alkaline clay {soil}over{limestone.}Little typical limestone grassland exists but the wide road verges - a characteristic feature - harbour many limestone grassland plants, with associated invertbrates, though early cutting prevents widespread seeding. Rodent inhabitants attract{kestrel}and{tawny {owl.}Sapperton woods consist largely of{oak}and{ash:}the many trunks of the latter indicate past{coppicing.}The understorey is{hazel}and{midland {hawthorn.}The herb layer is dominated by{nettles, bramble}and{dog's mercury but many other species occur including at least{2 orchids}and{bluebells. Small conifer plantations offer a much less species-rich habitat. In areas of damper ground{adder's tongue fern}is found and{lady's smock}attracts many{orange tip butterflies.
